criteria: Ability to accurately dial 9-1-1 or other emergency numbers (if applicable in their region).
Clarity and accuracy in providing essential information to the dispatcher (location, nature of emergency, assistance needed).
Demonstrates the ability to remain calm and composed while simulating the emergency call.
descriptions: Student does not attempt to dial or provide any emergency number.
Student attempts to dial an incorrect number or hesitates significantly.
Student dials the correct number with some prompting or minor errors.
Student confidently dials the correct number with minimal assistance.
Student dials the correct number quickly and efficiently without any assistance.
Student dials the correct number swiftly and accurately; explains why this number is important in emergencies.
Student is unable to provide any relevant information or speaks incoherently.
Student provides fragmented or unclear information, making it difficult to understand the emergency.
Student provides some essential information but omits important details or struggles to articulate clearly.
Student provides most essential information clearly and concisely, with minor omissions.
Student provides all essential information accurately, clearly, and concisely.
Student provides all essential information with exceptional clarity and anticipates follow-up questions a dispatcher might ask.
Student exhibits extreme panic or inability to speak.
Student is visibly anxious and struggles to maintain composure.
Student shows some nervousness but manages to convey the necessary information.
Student remains relatively calm and focused throughout the simulation.
Student demonstrates a calm and reassuring demeanor, effectively communicating the situation.
Student projects a calm, confident, and reassuring presence, able to guide others and maintain control of the simulated situation.
